STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
October 18, 2023
Mark Jones
Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130
Investigation #: 2023C0000770SI
Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant
Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood Suite 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 383-5636
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI670414130
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Tyrene Reginald Green
Chief Administrator: Mark Jones
Agency Name: Osceola Youth Center
Agency Address: 3030 Long Lane Rd
Evart, MI 49639
License Status: Original
License Expiration Date: 01/02/2024
Capacity: 16

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, medical condition, psychiatric condition, and personal
history, including any history of trauma, and must be done in a
manner consistent with the youth’s treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/14/23, there was an improper restraint in which youth fell to
the floor and staff member allegedly placed their elbow on youth's
neck. Youth is experiencing pain as a result. Youth's left cheek
appears swollen.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on September 18,
2023, and in person at the facility on September 21, 2023, and
reported they had no further information.
Assistant Facility Administrator, AFA, was interviewed face to
face at the facility on September 21, 2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. AFA stated she heard commotion in the gym
and went to the gym to see what was happening. AFA reported
the youth were lining up to leave the gym, two youth were having
a disagreement and Youth A was talking about his dead brother.
AFA stated she was talking with the youth about expectations
while Youth A continued to talk about his dead brother. AFA
reported Supervisor told Youth A they were not going to talk about
his dead brother and Youth A threw a basketball at Supervisor.
2

AFA stated Supervisor then placed Youth A in a restraint, they
went to the ground. AFA was trying to move Supervisor’s arm
from under Youth A because when they fell Supervisor’s arm was
under Youth A. AFA reported after she moved Supervisor’s arm,
she worked on securing Youth A’s arm to stop him from swinging.
AFA stated she had her back turned and did not see where
Supervisor’s forearm was placed. AFA reported she thought
Supervisor was trying to get control of Youth A's arm. AFA stated
during the restraint Youth A said Supervisor was pushing his
elbow into Youth A’s chest. AFA denied seeing Supervisor’s
elbow on Youth A’s chest. AFA reported her back was to
Supervisor and she was facing away from him when she was
securing Youth A’s arm. AFA described Staff 1 holding Youth A’s
legs. AFA reported Youth A was still talking about his dead
brother and Supervisor kept telling Youth A that they were not
going to talk about that right now. AFA stated she told Supervisor
to be quiet and she would calm Youth A down. AFA reported after
the restraint Youth A asked to go to his room. AFA described
Youth A going to his room for a short period of time then coming
out to talk with Supervisor. AFA stated she believed Youth A saw
Nurse the following day. AFA reported Youth A was offered a
grievance and she provided Youth A the form but was not sure if
Youth A filled out the grievance. AFA was asked if Supervisor did
the restraint as Safe Crisis Management (SCM) is taught, and
AFA said “no.” AFA stated staff are not trained to initiate a
restraint how Supervisor initiated the restraint. AFA denied seeing
Supervisor’s arm by Youth A’s neck. AFA denied Supervisor
targeting or arguing with Youth A. AFA reported in the same
situation she would have walked away from Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth A described being in the gym when two youth started
arguing so Supervisor told all of them to line up. Youth A said he
told Supervisor, “On my dead brother’s grave, not doing that.”
Youth A stated Supervisor said something he could not hear, and
kept walking toward Youth A. Youth A reported he pushed
Supervisor then grabbed a basketball and threw it at Supervisor.
Youth A described Supervisor grabbing Youth A, telling him to get
the “fuck down” and elbowing him in the face/throat three times.
Youth A reported he told Supervisor he could not breath and
Supervisor said, “sound real good don’t it.” Youth A stated he
tried to lean up for air and Supervisor elbowed him three more
times in the throat and chest then called Youth A a “bitch and
pussy.” Youth A described Staff 1 holding his legs and AFA
holding his left arm. Youth A denied AFA or Staff 1 saying
3

anything during the restraint. Youth A denied having any
concerns with AFA or Staff 1 on how they performed the restraint.
Youth A stated he has had some arguments with Supervisor in the
past but has not had any concerns with him until the restraint.
Youth A reported he laid on his back for about three minutes until
he was released from the restraint. Youth A stated he went to his
room for about 10-15 minutes, came out and went to dinner.
Youth A reported he had a busted lip, some bruises on his neck
and his jaw was swollen. Youth A stated Nurse examined him the
next day. Youth A reported this was the first restraint he has ever
been in.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 described being in the gym when two youth started arguing so
Staff 1 radioed for help. Staff 1 reported Supervisor entered the
gym and told the youth to line up. Staff 1 stated Youth A was
upset because he did not think he needed to line up because he
was not arguing and talked back to Supervisor. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor directed Youth A to line up and the two began arguing
back and forth. Staff 1 stated Youth A was saying fighting words
to Supervisor and Supervisor said, “what you going to do, huh you
not going to do anything.” Staff 1 described Supervisor “egging”
Youth A on, and that is when Youth A threw a basketball at
Supervisor. Staff 1 stated Supervisor and Youth A got into each
other’s face, and it appeared Supervisor placed Youth A in a
headlock and took Youth A to the ground. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor had his hand around Youth A’s neck area. Staff 1
stated AFA went to help and asked Staff 1 to secure Youth A’s
legs. Staff 1 was not sure if AFA saw Supervisor place Youth A in
a headlock or not. Staff 1 reported during the restraint Youth A
was saying Supervisor had his elbow on Youth A’s chest and it
hurt. Staff 1 reported Supervisor did not follow SCM training on
how a restraint is initiated or by having his elbow on Youth A’s
chest area and forearm on and by Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 stated
Supervisor did not have his arms where they should have been
during the restraint. Staff 1 reported Supervisor and Youth A were
both very escalated. Staff 1 denied seeing AFA reposition
Supervisor’s arms but stated he would not have been surprised if
she was trying to. Staff 1 stated he did not have any concerns
with how AFA did the restraint. Staff 1 stated his, “biggest
concern on how Supervisor initiated restraint and interaction with
youth.”
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
4

Nurse reported when she examined Youth A his left jaw was puffy,
and collarbone had bruising with blood to the surface area. Nurse
described Youth A as being really upset and a little bit shaken.
Nurse stated Youth A told her Supervisor had elbowed Youth A in
the neck and face. Nurse stated, “a push and moving elbow in
friction movement or roughness would cause bruising.” Nurse
reported Supervisor told her he “may have given him [Youth A] a
few extra elbows.” Nurse stated she told AFA what Supervisor
said to her.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Youth B described Supervisor and Youth A arguing, getting into
each other’s face, Supervisor pushing Youth A and Youth A
throwing a basketball at Supervisor then getting restrained. Youth
B reported Supervisor banged his elbow on Youth A’s neck and
head a couple of times. Youth B stated Supervisor had his elbow
on Youth A’s throat. Youth B denied ever seeing a restraint like
that before at the facility. Youth B reported AFA and Staff 1 were
involved in the restraint. Youth B denied having any concerns
with AFA or Staff 1 on how they did the restraint. Youth B stated
during the restraint Supervisor was talking a little bit, but Youth B
could not hear what Supervisor was saying. Youth B reported
Youth A was saying his throat hurt but that was all Youth B could
remember Youth A saying.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on September 27,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor
described entering the gym for a situation that had nothing to do
with Youth A. Supervisor stated Youth A became mad when he
was told he had to leave the gym, so he threw a basketball at
Supervisor. Supervisor reported walking toward Youth A and
Youth A threw a punch with his right hand, so Supervisor secured
Youth A’s left hand and placed him in an upper torso restraint.
Supervisor stated Youth A is a bigger kid and described Youth A
as being pretty worked up prior to the restraint. Supervisor
reported getting Youth A to the ground but having his arm stuck
under Youth A’s body. Supervisor stated AFA came to assist and
was able to help remove Supervisor’s arm from under Youth A.
Supervisor described his elbow being close to the corner of Youth
A’s shoulder blade, towards Youth A’s neck and jaw but denied
ever elbowing Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth A kept saying
Supervisor was elbowing him and choking him. Supervisor denied
both allegations. Supervisor stated he kept readjusting his arm.
Supervisor stated Youth A did not have any marks or bruises on
him and is unaware if Youth A saw Nurse. Supervisor denied
5

talking with Nurse about Youth A’s restraint. Supervisor stated
after Youth A threw the basketball at him, he should have walked
away and let AFA and Staff 1 deal with Youth A. Supervisor
described Youth A yelling at him and talking about Youth A’s
“dead homies.” Supervisor stated he told Youth A “we don’t care
about that.” Supervisor reported he “could have been better” but
AFA told him he was “fine.” Supervisor stated he could have gone
to the ground “cleaner,” but it was a challenge because Youth A is
a big kid. Supervisor described SCM teaches to do an upper
torso restraint from behind the youth but not from the front.
Supervisor stated he thought Youth A was going to punch him, so
he was trying to grab Youth A’s arm and pivot Youth A to get
behind him for the restraint.
DHHS Worker has findings with the investigation and Supervisor
will have a confirmed case.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of Youth A’s restraint on September 14, 2023, was
reviewed. The video shows Youth A throw a basketball at
Supervisor in the gym then approach Supervisor. Supervisor
walks toward Youth A, briefly places both of his hands on Youth
A’s shoulders, then moves to secure Youth A’s left arm with both
of his hands. Youth A attempts to move away and Supervisor
places his right hand/arm around the back of Youth A’s neck
pulling Youth A toward him (looks similar to a headlock). Youth A
is pulled toward Supervisor, and Supervisor is seen moving over
Youth A’s head and shoulders having his arms under Youth A’s
armpits taking Youth A to the ground. AFA is presenting and
watching this occur while trying to make contact. Youth A lands on
his side and rolls to his back with Supervisor laying on top Youth
A. AFA stands over Youth A and Supervisor, moves Youth A’s left
arm to a stretched-out position to the side of Youth A and moves
Supervisor’s right arm from under Youth A. Supervisor moves his
right arm from under Youth A and elbows Youth A in the
jaw/cheek area. Supervisor moves his elbow four different times
into Youth A’s throat, neck, and chest. Supervisor is seen
grinding his elbow into Youth A’s upper chest and collar bone area
multiple times.
Video shows AFA next to Supervisor when Supervisor and Youth
A have their hands on one another. AFA appears to be
attempting to move Supervisor’s hand and assist but Supervisor
goes to the ground with Youth A. Once on the ground, AFA is
seen moving Supervisor’s right arm out from under Youth A. AFA
moves Youth A’s left arm straight out from his side, sits down next
6

to Youth A and secures the left arm. AFA appears to say
something to Staff 1, Staff 1 walks over and secures Youth A’s
legs, and AFA repositions herself next to Youth A. Video shows
AFA turn her head multiple times looking at Supervisor when
Supervisor has his elbow on Youth A’s chest, neck, and
collarbone area and AFA does not intervene or reposition
Supervisor’s hand/elbow. AFA is seen on two occasions move
Supervisor’s hand/elbow from Youth A’s chest, but other times
AFA does not reposition Supervisor’s hand.
Video shows Staff 1 standing in the gym witnessing the entire
event between Supervisor and Youth A. Staff 1 is seen walking
over, sitting down next to Youth A and secure Youth A’s legs.
Documents Reviewed
• Incident Report 163080206 describing Youth A’s restraint:
The incident report was not consistent with what the video
showed or interviews with Staff 1, Youth A, and Youth B.
The incident report did not document Youth A was injured.
Nurse examined Youth A and documented red bruising on
neck and top of chest as well as by collar bones. Nurse
also documented Youth A’s left cheek was slightly swollen.
It was not documented that the restraint was not performed
according to the facility’s Safe Crisis Management restraint
model. AFA completed the incident report.
• Nurse Progress Note for Youth A, entry dated 9/15/2023
reads, “On 09/15/23 [Youth A] was examined regarding a
restraint youth has red bruising on neck and top of chest as
well as by collar bones. Left cheek was slightly swollen.
Youth also stated that staff [Supervisor] keep elbowing him
in face and throat. Youth appeared was very upset and
little shaken do to restraint.”
• Youth Opportunity Investments Post Emergency Physical
Intervention Physical Assessment for Youth A dated
9/15/23 states, “Youth states he was elbowed 6x’s in face
and held elbow to throat. Youth states throat still hurts.”
The form has a diagram of a person and Nurse circled right
collar bone area on the diagram and wrote, “redness w/welt
bruising.” Nurse also circled lower neck area on the
diagram and wrote, “redness w/welt bruising.”
• Assistant Facility Administrator’s, AFA, personnel file:
There were no disciplinary actions and AFA completed
Safe Crisis Management on July 26, 27, and 28, 2023.
• Supervisor’s personnel file: There was Notice of
Suspension letter dated September 14, 2023, pending the
7

investigation for Supervisor. Supervisor completed Safe
Crisis Management on July 26, 27, and 28, 2023.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There were no disciplinary actions
and Staff 1 completed Safe Crisis Management on July 26,
27, and 28, 2023.
• Youth Opportunity Grievance Form completed by Youth A
dated 9/15/23: Grievance form described being elbowed six
times in face and neck, Supervisor having his elbow on
Youth A’s throat and Supervisor using unprofessional
language.
• SCM Instructor’s Manual: Manual states for a Multiple-
person Supine Assist, the original staff release the
individual’s arm and places the same hand so the palm is 1’
above the individual’s forehead. The placement of the
hand above the forehead prevents biting and remains there
until the assist is complete. One staff always remains
posted over the forehead. The other staff places their
inside elbow on their corresponding thigh and leans away
from the chest cavity.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as after reviewing video
Supervisor did not use an approved SCM technique. Supervisor
did not properly position his hands when moving Youth A to the
ground as he placed his arms around Youth A’s head and neck.
Supervisor hand his forearm on Youth A’s chest and elbowed
Youth A in the chest/collar bone area multiple times. The video
shows Supervisor place his forearm on Youth A's chest and up
against Youth A’s neck. The video shows Supervisor move his
elbow in a grinding fashion into Youth A’s collarbone and upper
chest area.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff member lacks the ability to perform job duties.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 expressed concerns about Supervisor’s restraint and verbal
interaction with Youth A. Staff 1 described Supervisor “egging”
Youth A on and “arguing with him.” Staff 1 reported Supervisor
did not use the correct SCM techniques. Staff 1 stated Supervisor
was pressing his elbow into Youth A’s chest and Supervisor had
his forearm on and by Youth A’s neck at different times during the
8

restraint. Staff 1 did not offer to tap Supervisor out of the situation
or move Supervisor’s hand placement on Youth A. Staff 1 did not
intervene or report his concerns to anyone.
AFA was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. In interviewing
AFA, she confirmed watching the video recording of Supervisor
restraining Youth A. During the interview AFA did not express any
concern with Supervisor’s restraint only when directly questioned
if Supervisor did the restraint according to SCM training did AFA
say “no.” In the video AFA is seen looking at Supervisor while he
elbows Youth A in the upper chest and collarbone area.
Supervisor does this multiple times while AFA’s head is turned
toward Supervisor. AFA is standing next to Supervisor when
Supervisor places Youth A in a headlock and goes to the floor.
The incident report, authored by AFA, did not reflect this
information.
During a conference call on October 09, 2023, DHHS Worker
reported there was a preponderance of evidence and Supervisor
will have a confirmed case for placing Youth A in a headlock, and
pressing his elbow into Youth A’s neck, chest and collarbone.
Video Review:
Video shows AFA being next to Supervisor when Supervisor
places Youth A in a headlock and goes to the floor. AFA is seen
assisting to move Supervisor’s arm from underneath Youth A and
sitting next to Youth A to secure his left arm. AFA is seen looking
at Supervisor while he elbows Youth A in the upper chest and
collarbone area. Video also shows AFA’s head turned toward
Supervisor while Supervisor has his forearm on Youth A’s neck.
In the video Staff 1 is seen standing nearby watching Supervisor
place Youth A in a headlock and then helping to secure Youth A’s
legs when Youth A is on the floor.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Supervisor has a
confirmed case. Staff 1 and AFA failed to intervene when
Supervisor was being inappropriate.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to assure
compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238, MCL
722.621 to 722.638.
9

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation AFA and Staff 1 failed to report the actions of Supervisor’s
restraint of Youth A.
Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff
1 expressed concerns about Supervisor’s restraint and verbal
interaction with Youth A. Staff 1 described Supervisor “egging”
Youth A on and “arguing with him.” Staff 1 reported Supervisor
did not use the correct SCM techniques. Staff 1 stated Supervisor
was pressing his elbow into Youth A’s chest and Supervisor had
his forearm on and by Youth A’s neck at different times during the
restraint. Staff 1 didn’t report these concerns to anyone.
AFA was interviewed face to face at the facility on September
21, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. During the
interview AFA did not express any concern with Supervisor’s
restraint only when directly questioned if Supervisor did the
restraint according to SCM training did AFA say “no.” In the
video AFA is next to Supervisor when Supervisor places Youth A
in a headlock and goes to the floor. In the video AFA is seen
looking at Supervisor while he has his elbow on Youth A’s neck,
upper chest and collarbone area.
Documents Reviewed
• Osceola Youth Center, Provision of an Abuse Free
Environment Youth Rights, policy outlines: “All Youth
Opportunity programs shall promote an environment of
physical, psychological and emotional safety….All staff,
volunteers, interns or contracted staff shall immediately
report any allegations or suspicion of an incident of abuse
or harassment that has occurred in the program to
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
(MDHHS) Centralized Intake (CI) (1-855-444-3911).”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as AFA and Staff 1 did
report Supervisor’s actions of pressing his elbow into Youth A’s
chest, having his forearm on and by Youth A’s neck and
Supervisor grinding his elbow into Youth A’s collarbone area.
Conclusion Violation Established
10

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
October 16, 2023

Barbara A Cote Date
Licensing Consultant
